title: Impeached, Jailed Or Assassinated: South Korea's Dark History Of Leadership
content: After making an effort to suspend civilian rule in South Korea and impose martial law, President Yoon Suk Yeol stands facing impeachment. But that's not the only downfall the country has witnessed.
summary: After making an effort to suspend civilian rule in South Korea and impose martial law, President Yoon Suk Yeol stands facing impeachment. But that's not the only downfall the country has witnessed.

title: 14 Indian Fishermen Arrested Over Alleged Poaching, Says Sri Lankan Navy
content: The Sri Lankan Navy has said it has arrested 14 more Indian fishermen for allegedly fishing in the island nation's territorial waters and seized two fishing trawlers.
summary: The Sri Lankan Navy has said it has arrested 14 more Indian fishermen for allegedly fishing in the island nation's territorial waters and seized two fishing trawlers.

title: France's Macron Seeks New PM After No-Confidence Defeat
content: The vote was the first successful no-confidence action since a defeat for Georges Pompidou's government in 1962, when Charles de Gaulle was president.
summary: The vote was the first successful no-confidence action since a defeat for Georges Pompidou's government in 1962, when Charles de Gaulle was president.

title: Japan's "Divine Gift" Sake Recognised As UNESCO's Cultural Heritage
content: Producers hope this will boost interest in the traditional drink worldwide amid its waning popularity back home, with youngsters preferring imported wine, domestic beer or whiskey.
summary: Producers hope this will boost interest in the traditional drink worldwide amid its waning popularity back home, with youngsters preferring imported wine, domestic beer or whiskey.

title: Putin Praises PM Modi's Policies, Says Russia Will Now 'Make In India'
content: Russia will set up manufacturing plants across India, Vladimir Putin said today as he praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his "India-first" policies.
summary: Russia will set up manufacturing plants across India, Vladimir Putin said today as he praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his "India-first" policies.

title: Rapper Cardi B Claims She Spends About $3 Million A Month
content: Grammy-winning rapper Cardi B has put an end to rumours about her financial stability and revealed that she spends around $3 million a month.

title: Bangladesh Court Bans Broadcasts Of Sheikh Hasina's "Hate Speech"
content: A Bangladeshi tribunal banned broadcasts of "hate speech" by autocratic ex-premier Sheikh Hasina on Thursday, weeks after indicting her over the killing of protesters during the August revolution that ousted her.
summary: A Bangladeshi tribunal banned broadcasts of "hate speech" by autocratic ex-premier Sheikh Hasina on Thursday, weeks after indicting her over the killing of protesters during the August revolution that ousted her.

title: Bitcoin Blasts $100K Barrier Amid Trump's Vow To Make US "Crypto Capital"

title: This Type Of Chocolate Could Reduce Type 2 Diabetes Risk By 21%
content: A study from Harvard TH Chan School of Public Health reveals that consuming dark chocolate could reduce the risk of type 2 diabetes by 21%, unlike milk chocolate, which is linked to long-term weight gain.
summary: A study from Harvard TH Chan School of Public Health reveals that consuming dark chocolate could reduce the risk of type 2 diabetes by 21%, unlike milk chocolate, which is linked to long-term weight gain.

title: Will Donald Trump's Nominee Pete Hegseth Run Pentagon?

title: Scandals To Disasters: Yoon Suk Yeol, South Korea's Unpopular President
content: Yoon Suk Yeol's presidency of South Korea has been a rollercoaster of scandals and disasters. Now, he faces impeachment after imposing martial law and sending troops and helicopters to parliament.

title: Putin Lauds PM Modi's 'Make In India' Policy, Says Russia Willing To Invest

title: German Police Widen Berlin Doctor Probe To 40 Suspicious Deaths
content: German police are broadening their probe into a Berlin palliative care doctor suspected of killing eight elderly patients by looking at another 40 suspicious deaths, media reports said Wednesday.

title: "Voted In Favour Of 10, Abstained From 3 Gaza Resolutions": S Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, speaking in Parliament today, reaffirmed India's long-standing support for a two-state solution to the Israel-Palestine conflict by calling for the establishment of a "sovereign and independent" Palestine.
summary: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, speaking in Parliament today, reaffirmed India's long-standing support for a two-state solution to the Israel-Palestine conflict by calling for the establishment of a "sovereign and independent" Palestine.

title: US vs Russia As Foreign Ministers Face-Off At Key European Summit
content: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and his outgoing US counterpart Antony Blinken are due to face off over the war in Ukraine on Thursday at an annual meeting of the Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) in Malta.
